title: TFT rerolls seem to be non random
body:
Virtually every time I sell something  to get more rerolls I get the ones I sold out on the following rerolls.
If it was happening occasionally I could see it as bad luck but 70-80% of the time and in cases where I have done 20 rerolls prior to selling without getting anything.

replies.body:
The rolls are random, but the champion pool is shared which can make it semi-predictable.

https://i.imgur.com/XTUQ9yD.png

For example, say you have a level two Kindred and 5 Leonas (2-star + 2 1-stars) at Level 8. Other players are starting to get their purples, so let's say the game is averaging about 6-7 of each purple unit left in the pool. You sell that level 2 Kindred to get another Leona, and suddenly there are 10 Kindreds to the 6-7 of other purple units so you are more likely to see Kindred in the pool.

Naturally, you'll notice this phenomenon more with higher quality units since the total number of those qualities are lower and you'll notice more when some come back into the pool.

It's a lot like counting cards in Poker. The deal is always random, but you can make a prediction on the likelihood of certain cards/suits being dealt based on what has been taken out of the deck already.
Part of it is because the game seems to have moved to a tile type system for the re-rolls.  (That is, there is a set pool of champions that are available at each round. )
